page.title: 07Quarrying in The Shelsleys
page.content: { Woodbury Quarry}is owned by{Steetley {Minerals Ltd.}of Kilverton Park near Sheffield.{Wenlock Limestone}is quarried here for use in road and house construction; approximately 100,000 tons a year at a price of Â£2 a ton ex-quarry is excavated. The quarry is now at an estimated depth of 150 feet and may go deeper. There are six regular male employees and a further ten or twelve men are employed as haulage contractors. The take home pay is between Â£120 and Â£150 a week. The stone is extracted by drilling vertical bore four inch diameter holes on a twelve foot by twelve foot pattern with a pneumatic drill. The holes are then charged with various explosives and blasted. The stone is carried to a crusher by rubber tyred shovels, crushed and screened into various sizes.
